events.message: The customer reported an auto accident involving their car colliding with a street pole on April 30th, requesting claim initiation.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident as the incident involved vehicle collision and damage to the car.
A claims agent was assigned promptly to handle this auto accident case and guide the customer through the process.
The customer received official acknowledgement of the claim submission and confirmation that the investigation will begin shortly.
The agent requested photos of the damaged vehicle, police accident report, and a copy of the driver’s license for claim processing.
The customer submitted the requested documents including accident photos and official police report to support the claim.
The claims investigation team began reviewing all documents and evidence related to the reported car collision incident.
The investigation concluded with confirmation of the accident circumstances and assessment of the vehicle damage.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer covering repairs and damages based on the assessment report.
Customer responded positively to the proposed settlement and expressed satisfaction with the communication and process speed.
The claim was officially approved by the insurance company in line with the agreed settlement offer.
Payment for the approved settlement was issued to the customer’s account for vehicle repairs and associated costs.
The claim was officially closed after successful payment and confirmation that the customer’s vehicle repairs were proceeding.
All case files and documentation were archived securely to comply with records retention policies.
